nodes.title: EPA Remedial Investigation 2014
nodes.content: Comprehensive 1,591-page analysis of canal contamination levels, sediment composition, and proposed remediation strategies.

nodes.title: PCB Contamination Levels
nodes.content: Polychlorinated biphenyl concentrations exceeded safe levels by significant margins in multiple sediment samples.

nodes.title: 2013 Dolphin Incident
nodes.content: A dolphin was spotted swimming in the Gowanus Canal, sparking concerns about marine wildlife exposure to contaminated waters.

nodes.title: Coal Tar Deposits
nodes.content: Historical coal gasification operations left dense, toxic coal tar deposits throughout the canal bed.

nodes.title: CSO Overflow Events
nodes.content: Combined Sewer Overflow events continue to discharge untreated sewage into the canal during heavy rain.

nodes.title: Hazard Ranking System 2009
nodes.content: Documentation establishing the Gowanus Canal's placement on the National Priorities List for Superfund cleanup.

nodes.title: Feasibility Study 2011
nodes.content: Draft study evaluating various remediation approaches including dredging, capping, and in-situ treatment.

nodes.title: Potentially Responsible Parties
nodes.content: EPA identified multiple PRPs including current and former industrial property owners along the canal.

nodes.title: Public Health Assessment 2017
nodes.content: NY State Department of Health evaluation of health risks to nearby residents from canal contamination.

nodes.title: Proposed Remedial Action Plan 2012
nodes.content: EPA's proposed plan for canal cleanup including timelines, methods, and estimated costs.

nodes.title: Heavy Metal Contamination
nodes.content: Elevated levels of mercury, lead, copper, and zinc detected throughout canal sediments.

nodes.title: Historical Industrial Use
nodes.content: The canal served coal yards, gas plants, tanneries, and chemical factories from the 1870s through 1960s.

nodes.title: Sediment Dredging Timeline
nodes.content: Proposed multi-phase dredging operation to remove approximately 307,000 cubic yards of contaminated sediment.

nodes.title: Community Concerns
nodes.content: Local residents expressed concerns about odors, construction impacts, and long-term health effects during public comment periods.

nodes.title: Gowanus Canal Smell
nodes.content: Hydrogen sulfide emissions create notorious odor, with EPA noting smell was 'worse than expected.'

nodes.title: Water Quality Testing
nodes.content: Ongoing monitoring of dissolved oxygen, pH, temperature, and contaminant levels throughout the canal.

nodes.title: Brooklyn Development Pressure
nodes.content: Rapid real estate development along the canal has increased public attention and cleanup urgency.

nodes.title: Ecological Impact Studies
nodes.content: Research on contamination effects on benthic organisms, fish populations, and canal ecosystem health.

nodes.title: Estimated Cleanup Cost
nodes.content: EPA estimated total remediation costs between $300-500 million, with PRPs bearing financial responsibility.

nodes.title: Future Canal Vision 2050
nodes.content: Community-imagined futures ranging from restored ecosystem to ongoing contamination struggles.
